tool.name: CNVkit Segmetrics
tool.command: ln -s '$input_filename_file' ./sample.cnr && #if $segments ln -s '$segments' ./sample.cns && #end if cnvkit.py segmetrics ./sample.cnr --output gene_segmetrics.cns #if $segments --segments ./sample.cns #end if $advanced_settings.mean $advanced_settings.median $advanced_settings.mode $advanced_settings.ttest $advanced_settings.stdev $advanced_settings.sem $advanced_settings.mad $advanced_settings.mse $advanced_settings.iqr $advanced_settings.bivar $advanced_settings.ci $advanced_settings.pi $advanced_settings.alpha $advanced_settings.bootstrap

param.label: Drop very-low-coverage bins before segmentation
param.help: To avoid false-positive deletions in poor-quality tumor samples

tool.help: Calculate summary statistics of the residual bin-level log2 ratio estimates from the segment means, similar to the existing metrics command, but for each segment individually. Results are output in the same format as the CNVkit segmentation file (.cns), with the stat names and calculated values printed in additional columns.
